did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad photographs, circa 1917.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Black and white photographs of trains, railroad bridges, tracks, stations, and tunnels along the routes of the Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad in western New York and possibly Pennsylvania.

bioghist.p: The Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad was formed from the merger of five small railroads in New York and Pennsylvania in 1899. It declared bankruptcy in 1905, but continued to operate in receivership until 1946, when its bankruptcy was converted to a trusteeship. It ceased to operate in April 1947.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Black and white photographs of trains, railroad bridges, tracks, stations, and tunnels along the routes of the Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad in western New York and possibly Pennsylvania, with captions in pencil on the back. Includes photographs of the railroad stations at Little Genesee, New York and Angelica, New York; but the locations of most of the other photographs are unidentified. One of the photographs depicts a fire that broke out in Angelica on May 15, 1917.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad Photographs, #1967. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

unittitle.extref: Link to a partial finding aid.

scopecontent.p: All the material in the collection may not be covered by this guide.
